15.author: by Stuart Arden

Includes bibliographical references.

51.heading: Brel, Jacques.

notes: Summary: Henrietta gets a visit from Jacques Brel, who cheers her up and gives her strength to tell the rest of the family some truth about itself.

52.title: Brelan de Dames
52.author: Renaud ; J
notes: ca. 50 p. : col. ill. ; 31 cm.
Pages of the comic feature Brelan de Dames, cut from issues of the magazine Tintin and bound with a cardboard cover. The final episode is dated 1982.

53.title: Brelan de Dames
53.author: R
53.appears_in: Denauw ; J.-L. Vernal. 4 p. in Tintin, ann. 35, no. 19 (May 6, 1980).
notes: "A suivre."

54.title: Brelan de Dames
54.author: R
54.appears_in: Denauw ; J.-L. Vernal. 3 p. in Tintin, ann. 35, no. 20 (May 13, 1980).
notes: "Résumé: Pour Jaimie, adorable agent très secret recluse dans une petite île perdue de la mer des Caraïbes, les vacances ne sont pas de tout repos: tandis que d'inquiétants visiteurs armés venus du ciel explorent son domaine, le signal sonore qui a interrompu sa sieste paresseuse au soleil l'a entrainée dans le 'centre nerveux' de son repaire."
"A suivre."

55.title: Brelan de Dames
55.author: R
55.appears_in: Denauw ; J.-L. Vernal. 3 p. in Tintin, ann. 35, no. 21 (May 20, 1980).
notes: "Résumé: Tout en gardant le contact vidéo avec son mystérieux correspondant, Jaimie est parvenue à se débarrasser de ses visiteurs indiscrets en les précipitant dans une trappe ménagée dans son living."
"A suivre."

56.title: Brelan de Dames
56.author: R
56.appears_in: Denauw ; J.-L. Vernal. 3 p. in Tintin, ann. 35, no. 22 (May 27, 1980).
notes: "Résumé: Trois femmes, Jaimie, Amanda Wenn et Laurence Tonkin, reçoivent chacune une mystérieuse convocaton écrite au dos d'une carte à jouer: 'Rendez-vous à Londres, Hôtel Hilton, chambre 2407'."
"A suivre."

72.title: Brenda Starr
72.author: by Ramona Fradon and Mary Schmich.
72.series: Dec. 23, 1988) "Anybody Who Tries to Catch Kingpin in This House will be Dog Meat in 10 Seconds"*
notes: Summary: Every nark south of Siberia is stalking Kingpin, and he's trapped in his house like an eagle in a canary's cage.

73.title: Brenda Starr
73.author: Fradon & Schmich.
73.series: June 15, 1989) "I Don't Have Time for Lawn Bowlers"*
notes: Summary: As Brenda buys a gun, a man at the remains of the hotel is rebuffed by the police.

74.title: Brenda Starr
74.author: by Ramona Fradon and Mary Schmich.
74.series: Aug. 17, 1991) "My Little Spaceship Only Holds One Passenger"*
notes: Summary: The pilot wants to know if there's a Tupperware party at the black orchid farm, since she's the second lady looking for it.

75.title: Brenda Starr
75.author: Fradon and Schmich.
notes: Summary: The biographer is on the track of a story, about a man risen from the dead.

76.title: Brenda Starr
76.author: Fradon and Schmich.
76.series: Sept. 11, 1992) "If Love is a Brute who Tackles You and Leaves You Maimed"*
notes: Summary: Brenda asks, was it love?

77.title: Brenda Starr
77.author: Fradon and Schmich.
77.series: Nov. 20, 1992) "All You have to do is be a Brute and You're a Hero"*
notes: Summary: Brenda reflects on the nature of football.

78.title: Brenda Starr
78.author: Fradon and Schmich.
78.series: June 15, 1993) "Australia. Costa Rica. Somewhere I Can Make Sure that the Law and My Sisters Don't Find Mother and Me"*
notes: Summary: Brenda is invited to go away.

79.title: Brenda Starr
79.author: Fradon and Schmich.
79.series: Sept. 11, 1993) "He Said He Could Tell Me Things about the Riverboat Casino Proposal that would Curl my Pantyhose"*
notes: Summary: Brenda's going to see Joker Spade, hoping for a scoop.

80.title: Brenda Starr
80.author: Fradon and Schmich.
80.series: Sept. 24, 1993) "I Never Trust an Editor Beloved by Movers and Shakers"*
notes: Summary: Pressman's giving a speech at the Civic Club dinner.

81.title: Brenda Starr
81.author: by Ramona Fradon and Mary Schmich.
81.series: Sept. 25, 1993) "Making Pasta Isn't Cooking. It's Boiling Water"*
notes: Summary: Brenda cooks for Hank, and they make a toast to P. Post Pressman.

82.title: Brenda Starr
82.author: by Ramona Fradon and Mary Schmich.
notes: Summary: Brenda and Hank are on the riverboat. Brenda's posing as "Lucky Roulette," and Hank is cross-dressing as "Jack Black."

83.title: Brenda Starr
83.author: Fradon and Schmich.
83.series: Nov. 23, 1993) "Everybody in Here has Cut a Deal with the Moguls who want Riverboat Casinos in the State"*

84.title: Brenda Starr
84.author: by Ramona Fradon and Mary Schmich.
84.series: May 6, 1994) "Shh! They're About to Give the Best Actress Award"*
notes: Summary: Watching on TV, they see Starr Sizzle (who "embodies the alienation and anomie" of her generation) next to Kevin Costner.

85.title: Brenda Starr
85.author: by Ramona Fradon and Mary Schmich.
85.series: June 21, 1995) "To Abuse a Line from Shakespeare, 'I Am Nothing if Not Discreet'"*
notes: Summary: Brenda blurts out a secret, and her trainer says not to worry.
The quote probably refers to Iago, in Othello (act 2 scene 1), saying, "I am nothing if not critical."

86.title: Brenda Starr
86.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
notes: Summary: Ms. Puffington attacks the cleaning lady with insults and a wastebasket, and Brenda goes to intervene.
Key words: Overpaid, underdressed slobs, trash.

87.title: Brenda Starr
87.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
notes: Summary: Ms. Puffington says to Mrs. Scrubs, 'You're the maid, I'm the columnist', Brenda says that being a columnist is just a job, and Puffington says she makes three times as much as Starr.
Key words: Trashbag hag, salaries.

88.title: Brenda Starr
88.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
88.series: July 30, 1997) "Service People are Such a Pain!"*
notes: Summary: Hank seems to confirm that Puffington is making three times as much as Brenda, and sends Brenda to cover a fire.
Key words: Underfoot, coffee breaks, salaries, ashes.

89.title: Brenda Starr
89.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
89.series: July 31, 1997) "Home to Me and a Hundred Other Lost Souls"*
notes: Summary: Brenda covers a fire that has destroyed the Home for Infants and the Elderly; a victim has lived there since her daughter stole all her money eight years ago.

90.title: Brenda Starr
90.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
notes: Summary: The old people felt they were contributing to society by taking care of unwanted babies.
Key word: Childcare.

91.title: Brenda Starr
91.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
91.series: Aug. 2, 1997) "I'll Pitch it for Page One"*
notes: Summary: The fire story is a heartbreaker, but Vanity Puffington thinks it's a waste of money to cover a story about poor people, and she's marrying the publisher.
Key word: Spending, front page.

92.title: Brenda Starr
92.author: Brigman and Schmich.
92.series: Oct. 1, 1997) "Vanity and Gov. Stonehart are in Bed Together"*
notes: Summary: Brenda tells Hank her suspicions: Vanity's ex-husband dies on Skid Street, then Vanity's column on Skid Street prompts the governor to act.

93.title: Brenda Starr
93.author: Brigman and Schmich.
93.series: Feb. 11, 1999) "Tales of Late-Night Love, or Just the Seedy Side of Life?"*
notes: Summary: Brenda conjectures about what a mannequin in a store window would say if it could talk, and a man with a bottle approaches.

94.title: Brenda Starr
94.author: Brigman and Schmich.
94.series: Feb. 12, 1999) "Hey, Call Off the Pit Bull"*
notes: Summary: A little dog defends Brenda from a hostile beggar.

95.title: Brenda Starr
95.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
95.series: Feb. 13, 1999) "You Were Very Brave to Save Me from that Creep, Pooch"*
notes: Summary: The dog is now following Brenda.

96.title: Brenda Starr
96.author: Brigman and Schmich.
notes: Summary: Brenda sees a dog hit by a car, and the driver speeds away.

97.title: Brenda Starr
97.author: Brigman and Schmich.
97.series: Feb. 17, 1999) "Come on Pooch, Let's Blow This Party"*
notes: Summary: Brenda picks up an injured dog.

98.title: Brenda Starr
98.author: Brigman and Schmich.
98.series: Feb. 18, 1999) "Pets and Their Owners Get Crazy in the Middle of the Night"
notes: Summary: Brenda finds a veterinarian open late.

99.title: Brenda Starr
99.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
99.series: Feb. 20, 1999) "Oh, All Right! But No More Licking!"*
notes: Summary: Brenda protests, then decides to take the dog home to her apartment.

100.title: Brenda Starr
100.author: Brigman and Schmich.
100.series: Feb. 22, 1999) "Ok, Patch, Lead Me to Your Owner"*
notes: Summary: Patch is riding in Brenda's backpack.

101.title: Brenda Starr
101.author: Brigman and Schmich.
101.series: Feb. 23, 1999) "It's a Sure Sign of Endless Youth or Encroaching Senility When You Think Dogs can Talk"*
notes: Summary: Patch is barking two for left and one for right turns as he leads Brenda.

102.title: Brenda Starr
102.author: Brigman and Schmich.
102.series: Feb. 24, 1999) "Nothing Helps You Socialize in the City like a Baby or a Dog"*
notes: Brenda gets compliments from other dog owners on her dog and his eyepatch.

103.title: Brenda Starr
103.author: Brigman and Schmich.
103.series: Feb. 25, 1999) "This is the Street where that Car Hit You"*
notes: Patch is in Brenda's backpack, directing her steps.

104.title: Brenda Starr
104.author: Brigman and Schmich.
104.series: Feb. 27, 1999) "You Were Really Slumming It With Me"*
notes: Patch has brought Brenda to an expensive looking house.

105.title: Brenda Starr
105.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
105.series: Mar. 23, 1999) "I Can't Tell Him It's Just my Dog"*
notes: Summary: Brenda makes an excuse to Brother Max about someone waiting for her at home.

106.title: Brenda Starr
106.author: Brigman and Schmich.
106.series: Apr. 5, 1999) "How About a Little Less Charm, Max?"*
notes: Summary: Max talks to Patch about how to charm Brenda.

107.title: Brenda Starr
107.author: Brigman and Schmich.
107.series: Apr. 6, 1999) "Handsome Beasts of All Species Just Follow You Around, Huh?"*
notes: Summary: Patch likes Max.

108.title: Brenda Starr
108.author: Brigman and Schmich.
108.series: Apr. 21, 1999) "How'd You Know This Glenda Carr had the Dog?"*

109.title: Brenda Starr
109.author: Brigman and Schmich.
109.series: July 3, 1999) "I'm Sure I Heard a Dog Bark!"*
notes: Summary: Patch is hiding in the foliage, Karma goes to look for him.

110.title: Brenda Starr
110.author: Brigman and Schmich.
110.series: July 9, 1999) "How Much of the World Did You Intend to Destroy, Karma?"*
notes: Summary: They were just going to destroy the overcivilized nations, but then their doggie bomb ran away.

111.title: Brenda Starr
111.author: Brigman and Schmich.
111.series: July 29, 1999) "What Happened to the Good Old Days when Damsels in Distress were Rescued by Men, not Dogs?"*
notes: Summary: Patch jumps into Brenda's arms, and Brenda calls him Superdog.

112.title: Brenda Starr
112.author: Brigman and Schmich.
112.series: Aug. 2, 1999) "Politics Get Slimier Every Day, Patch!"*
notes: Summary: Brenda listens to Bernie Scuzzo, a private eye who does "opposition research" for political candidates.

113.title: Brenda Starr
113.author: Brigman and Schmich.
113.series: Aug. 3, 1999) "Alas, the Broadcast was Interrupted when he Lost His Eye"*
notes: Summary: The chip in Patch's eye was a camera.

114.title: Brenda Starr
114.author: Brigman and Schmich.
notes: Summary: Patch had a camera in his head, a canine Austin Powers.

115.title: Brenda Starr
115.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
115.series: Aug. 14, 1999) "No Sir, I Mean the Dog"*
notes: Summary: At the airport leaving for home, someone tells Brenda that the handsome creature at her side is her luck charm.

116.title: Brenda Starr
116.author: Brigman and Schmich.
116.series: Aug. 20, 1999) "By the Way, No Dogs in the Newsroom!"*
notes: Summary: Brenda suggests ironically that "the newspaper should be all movie reviews, restaurant tips, comics and gossip columns," and the boss says she's showing management potential.

117.title: Brenda Starr
117.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
117.series: Sept. 11, 1999) "A Guy with Your Past, Slick, Should Avoid that Topic"*
notes: Summary: Out golfing with Scuzzo, the opposition candidate tries to suggest ways to start a scandal.

118.title: Brenda Starr
118.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
118.series: Mar. 8, 2000) "Why Should Middle-Aged People Be Any Less Foolish than Anybody Else?"*
notes: Summary: Brenda talks about middle age and marriage.

119.title: Brenda Starr
119.author: Brigman and Schmich.
119.series: Sept. 29, 2000) "Licking Things Clean is Not an Option!"*
notes: Summary: Brenda studies the uses of vinegar and club soda for cleaning, and Patch has his own methods.

120.title: Brenda Starr
120.author: Bridgman & Schmich.
120.series: Oct. 6, 2000) "Is Pewter Safe in the Dishwasher?"*
notes: Summary: Brenda is quizzed about the care of antiques, wood floors and pewter.

121.title: Brenda Starr
121.author: Brigman and Schmich.

122.title: Brenda Starr
122.author: Brigman and Schmich.
122.series: July 6, 2004) "We're in England, Now. Different Code"*
notes: Summary: Brenda is talking about a "newspaper code of ethics."

123.title: Brenda Starr
123.author: Brigman and Schmich.
notes: Summary: Brenda bumps his bandaged arm, and he seems to have forgotten that it hurts.

124.title: Brenda Starr
124.author: Brigman and Schmich.
124.series: July 9, 2004) "I'll Hang Out Here Till the Next Ferry"*
notes: Summary: Brenda is on assignment, and heads for the village.

125.title: Brenda Starr

notes: Summary: She helps the dogs attack the man.
